name: Wynn Las Vegas

reviews.title: Loved the Wynn
reviews.text: Stayed at the Wynn for three nights in a tower suite room.

reviews.title: Quality with some surprises
reviews.text: The best part of the tower suites for me was the amazing service. Absolutely every staff member we encountered during our three night stay went above and beyond to do their utmost to make our stay very special. Mr. Wynn obviously insists upon only the best in customer service and for my money, that is the most important feature of any business and their customers.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: I also loved that all of the rooms were within easy walking distance to the elevator and the pool access was very close by the elevator banks, too. Those two things alone were enough to make me hope I will get the chance to stay here again.

reviews.title: Room with a View
reviews.text: Our room overlooked the strip and had a lovely view of the mountains directly to the west. We had fun playing with all of the buttons that operate the lights and drapes. We were happy that the closet held two luggage racks, one for each of us. The flat screen wall mounted TV impressed my husband.

reviews.title: Best Hotel in Vegas!
reviews.text: We enjoyed the sofa and large mirror in the foyer area. The bed was VERY comfortable with the best linens I have ever slept on. We did hear quite a bit of loud traffic noises from the strip but it didn't really bother us. The robes were nicer than the standard terry cloth issued ones at most hotels and the maid laid out your complimentary slippers for you every night at turndown.

reviews.title: loved the wynn!
reviews.text: This is the best hotel in Vegas. From the pool, to the service, to the casino, to the restaurants... This is the best property in Vegas. I had never stayed on the property but had visited several times and knew I wanted to stay here. When I was booking the trip, I was torn between the Bellagio and the Wynn. Looking back, I have no desire to stay anywhere else. We visited the Bellagio during our time in Vegas and after staying in the Wynn, it looks old, dated and dirty. Im so happy with our decision to stay at the Wynn. My only complaints are: we requested a smoking room, got a non-smoking room and had to switch the next day which is not a fun event. Surprisingly, the smoking room was even nicer than the non. We stayed on the 50th floor with a great view. Second complaint: No where do they tell you that they will charge you $200.00 per night for a security deposit. For a person like me who does not carry ANY credit cards, I was upset. I asked if I could give them cash and get my deposit when I check out. They said no. I make a point to carry cash. I could have easily planned for this had I been told prior to my arrival.

reviews.title: This place is a WOW!
reviews.text: I have been through every property on the strip, and none of them compare to the Wynn. (The new ones Aria, Cosmo, etc, don't really add anything interesting or worthy to Vegas in my opinion)

reviews.title: VERY nice place for the price
reviews.text: From the gorgeous lobby to the expansive and luxurious rooms, every detail has been attended to. Considering how many people traipse through every day it is a miracle the place is so well kept. Everything is sparkling. They really did it right. My room, was just a regular room, but I got a high floor, right near the elevator as requested. And boy was it beautiful. I have paid twice in luxury hotels throughout the world and not been in such a clean, beautiful room. My only quibble was the $13.95 a night for the internet - but the amazingly comfortable pillows made up for it! They were so awesome that I bought two of them and had them shipped back home.

reviews.title: Probably the best and definitely one of the best hotels in Las Vegas
reviews.text: Stayed here several times for work conventions and when it comes to Vegas, these hotels speak for themselves. The Wynn is one of the most elite hotels for the price with over 3,000 reviews. So what else can I add to this hotel besides the luxury atmosphere, fine dining cuisine, and upscale rooms?

reviews.title: stay at wynn
reviews.text: The SMELL! I have really sensitive allergies and can have a sneeze attack whenever allergens want to play hardball. I ALWAYS notice The Wynn pumping some type of fragrance to keep the hotel fresh. You're in Vegas so 99% of the hotels will smell like smoke.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: This is my favorite trip of my summers. You don't have to be 21 to have a good time. Amazing food. Fabulous pool, rooms and in-hotel shopping.

We couldn't fault this hotel. Great helpful staff, able to organise and assist with every request. The rooms are just awesome. Great quality beds, roomy bathroom and also loved the TV!! Excellent range of restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The casino itself is very new and the tables and slots are not crowded - which is very pleasing when compared to some other casinos. The shows on offer are also of first class. If the wife loves high end shopping or a club to dance and drink the night away this is the place to be. Oh yeah, the pool - awesome - a great place to relax or even have a gamble. I love this place. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Simply Perfect
Wynn Las Vegas
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel, Great Pool and amenities. Excellent location rooms are very spacious and decorated well. Would stay there again.

It is a very nice hotel, but so very expensive and I don't see that it is much different than any of the other 4 or 5 star ones along the strip. We were on the 58th floor( and had to pay an extra $100.00 to check in early and to get to the 58th floor, that was not even overlooking the strip.) and could still hear the noise from outside . We could hear every door in the hallway open and close. Coffee with a flavor shot $5.13...plain bagel $4.00 and you even have to butter it yourself!!! Roast beef sandwich $10.95 and also butter the bread yourself. Dinner buffet for 2 is $75.00. This was my 6th trip to Vegas and will not be going back there for my 7th trip. Glad there are lots of other places to choose from!!!!!!!
reviews.title: overrated, toronto Canada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this place! Just loved it! It was soooo hard to come back home to reality. I was there for the NASCAR Champions Ball and it was a great change over New York City! So much more fun and a much better hotel than the Waldorf Astoria (which is very nice don't get me wrong, but I just love Vegas more than NY).
reviews.title: The Wynn is a HUGE WIN!!

reviews.text: I read many reviews before booking the Wynn, and my friends had already booked, so I booked here too. My concerns were the noise and the sun by the pool. I stayed in room 2217. 22nd floor overlooking the strip, not the golf course. Yes, I could hear the music at night, not extremely loud, but yes there was some noise, which was disappointing, because when I checked in I was told that this room was quiet, but I guess they aren't going to say its going to be loud. The view was amazing, I loved it. So the pool(s) - The sun did go behind the hotel around 2pm, but there was sun at the main pool until 4:30 or later, I should say, at some parts of the main pool, you would need to move to follow the sun. There was a separate pool for the Tower rooms, this pool started to get shade at 2pm, and was in complete shade shortly after. The Tower pool was for guests who stayed in the Tower rooms, my friends stayed in a Tower room and I was able to join them at the Tower pool. This pool was small. Tower pool was the only area where you could get an umbrella, if you got there early enough, and if not, you put your name on a list. The main pool had no umbrellas and little shade, until later in the day. Both pools became warmer as the day went on, because it was over 100 degrees outside. At the Tower pool you were given complimentary bottled water and fruit during the day. The Tower rooms were an upgrade for $35 a day, over the typical room. I had a typical room and it was awesome. I knew about the resort fee, and was ok with that. The Tower room, for $35 more a day, waived the resort fee. So you spend $35 instead of $25. I didn't upgrade. I was very happy with my room. The casino was quiet compared to other casinos, maybe they turn down the volume on the machines, or maybe people weren't winning? The Wynn is at the end of the strip, I am a huge fan of MGM, and the location. We were able to walk to the Fountains at Bellagio from Wynn.
reviews.title: Wynn
Not good so far
reviews.text: OH..the BEST part of Wynn...The Drugstore...its a small store...open 24 hours a day...in the way back..in a corner...they sell cold beers..I was able to get a bottle of Sam Adams for $4..! Which to me...was a deal...after a day at the pool on the way back to my room I would grab a couple beers. Food. Buffet for brunch one day and breakfast another. Brunch was around $34 a person, and I did it to see what they had, and they had choices, would I do it again, no. Breakfast on another day was $21...again...variety...I may do it again...I like choices. We also ate at Zoozacrackers Deli, salads, chicken fingers...not too bad price wise and the food was good. We tried Terrace Pointe Cafe for lunch...it was good..cobb salad was around $16 I think, but it was a big salad!! We went off hotel for our big dinner out, so I can't comment on the fine dining choices within Wynn. Le Reve, AMAZING, you should see it. I want to see it again, I said that as soon as the show ended. It was fascinating. Overall Wynn didn't disappoint me, but I think I could get a better deal more centrally located, like I said, MGM is where my heart is.

We are currently staying at the Wynn.mour room wreaks of smoke when we had asked for a non smoking room. So far the management has not done anything about it other than sending a cleaning lady with an air freshner and telling us they don't have any other rooms. Long lines for the elevators, crowded pool and mediocre food so far. Not a happy customer.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: I have just returned from a two night stay at the Wynn and I really wish I had been able to stay longer. The place is pure luxury and sheer indulgence from start to finish. Booking in was easy and they were happy to change the room I was originally offered to a room with more of a view, we ended up on the 14th floor overlooking the golf course. Higher up would have been an even better view but I wasn't complaining as the room was incredible.I couldn't hear any club noise I was there on a Monday and Tuesday and only the Encore club was on on Monday night and this is located in their esplanade.There is a panel in the room that shuts/opens the curtains and turns the lights on/off for you with a flick of a switch, the bathroom is huge with a shower, a deep bath, his and hers basins with all the luxury toiletries you could wish for. The bed is so comfortable and was the best night's sleep I had on the whole of my two week trip in the US. Don't touch the mini bar or use the fridge though not unless you want to incur a hefty fee!!!! The hotel itself is amazing its clean, plush, fab shops and eateries, helpful courteous staff and it doesn't smell of smoke or weird air freshener unlike some of the other casinos/hotels I went to. The pool is huge, by the late afternnon one half of the pool is in shade but in the vegas heat this might not be a bad thing for some, besides which its quite easy to swim to the sunny half or walk there as the pool is not overly deep. There are plenty of sunbeds and plenty of opportunity to order a drink from the hostesses that walk the pool area. I ate at the Terrace point cafe for breakfast and again its perfect customer service all the way. The food was gorgeous, have the flakey croissant you wont be diasppointed.Yes the hotel amenities are pricey but no more so than any of the other hotels in Vegas but at the Wynn it's definitely worth the price and I'm already thinking of going back next year.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Amazing experience

reviews.text: The Wynn is the best Las Vegas hotel we've stayed at. It's going to be completely worth it. If you want the "true wynn experience", stay at the Wynn Tower Suites. Not only will you experience the private "hidden" entrance to the amazing hotel, breakfast & lunch daily is included, their is a private pool, private access to the shopping area and quicker access to the strip. The rooms are fantastic. It was the best hotel room I've ever experience and being avid travelers, that's something hard to do with us. The check in at the front desk could be quicker and they could be more on top of it but that was forgotten. The bell staff who handle your bags are fantastic. Doors opened for you everywhere. The room comes equipped with two fridges. Yes, two! One is for your own items and they other is stocked daily with great beverages & food. The room has plenty of natural light & views of treasure island, mirage and the fashion show mall. While you're at the hotel you must have a dinner at SW Steakhouse and ask to have a view of the watershow. It's away from other hotels on the strip but really, you'll as you have no need to leave the property as they have everything you need. This hotel will be an experience you can only dream of.
reviews.title: horrible

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Wynn for 5 nights in a resort deluxe room.We had stayed at the Palazzo (at the Venetian) for the three days prior. We arrived early and were delighted that there was a room available for early check in. The foyer is gorgeous as is the room and hotel restaurants and pools. I recommend Red 8 Asian cuisine. It was probably the best I've eaten. Also the buffet is amazing (don't be deterred by the long queue, it moves quickly). The pool area lovely and plenty of sun lounges so you don't have to get there super early. Our room was on the 23rd floor with lovely views, huge bathroom and very comfortable beds. My only complaint would be the noise from the nightclub. Being so high up I would have thought we wouldn't hear it but it is very loud. Not sure how they could fix this. Would definitely stay here again next time.
reviews.title: Best Hotel on the Strip

reviews.text: Enormous rooms, aweosme pools, amazing restaurants!
reviews.title: One of the best in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was perfect!
reviews.title: Amazing first time to Vegas

reviews.text: I think we probably spoiled ourselves stay at the Wynn for our first trip to Vegas. We took a cab from the airport to throttle (about $30) and checked in right away, thre was no line and we got two bottles of cold water.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay........At The Wynn Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the 27th floor with a view of the strip. Loved the automatic drapes and sheers opening and there was a control on our night table for light control and privacy button. The room was gorgeous with Picasso paintings everywhere. We got 2 free waters on our nightstands. The bathroom was huge. We didn't hear the club noise, but could see the fireworks and explosions from the sirens of ti show at treasure island.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mr Wynn certainly has an eye for detail and both the Wynn and Encore are fabulous, high-end properties. Having stayed for 7 nights we were not disappointed, (well only a bit, more later)
reviews.title: Some you Wynn, some you lose..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take a look at the Wynn/Encore website if you want an accurate overview of the plush decoration and beautiful hotel; both properties are really stunning.
reviews.title: Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous

reviews.text: We were checked in to room facing the golf-course on floor 32. The room was nice, but a little dissapointing decor-wise after the visual lush-ness of the public areas, bars and casino of the hotel itself. The bed and linens were great quality. The bathroom too was large and comfortable with a small tv near the vanity area. I liked that the closet was in the hallway rather than the bedroom area. There was a small sofa and table, desk/workspace and another table and chair set-up for eating. There is of course the very expensive mini-bar and snacks available - all on a 60 second timer, so do hurry up if only browsing!
reviews.title: Go here if you're after service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tv had some good information channels, mood music and account checking/check-out features.
reviews.title: Over Rated and Outrageous Prices on Extras

reviews.text: All of these facilities made for a very pleasant stay, but we did have a few niggles.
reviews.title: Steve Wynn Knows Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and well marked. Our view was amazing. The food at the buffett was ok. There just wasn't much of a selection and it was not worth $40 a person. Overall, it was an amazing trip. We will definitely stay at the Wynn again.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: I have stayed in alot of hotels on the strip, but you can't beat the view overlooking the golf course. You will enjoy the spectacular sunrise over the mountains. Stayed for the weekend and still did not see all of the facilities offered at the hotel.
reviews.title: Weekend Get a Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Wynn was splendid, we went for our wedding and also for our first wedding anniversary. The rooms are stylish and spacious, the bath is fab and the staff were wonderful!
reviews.title: Amazing, can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: I stayed for my birthday for three nights the weekend of June 17, 2012 in room 3384. When I arrived with my children at approximately 7:30pm we could not check in. We had to wait about two hours before our room was ready. After checking in and sending the girls to sleep, we were awakened by two people entering out room. They had been checked into our room at maybe 10pm?! I could not get the front desk to answer, so I called the operator and reminded her I was registered to the room, not the second party they had given access to our room. As I was packing to leave on Monday, I looked under the cabinet and beds for random socks and my girls blankets. I found a used bag of condoms under the bedside dresser, a club wrist band under one bed, and some used feminine products under the other bed skirt. I was disgusted by the filth and general lack of cleanliness and wrote a note to the hotel manager. I asked for an explanation/response, and three weeks later and I have yet to hear from The Wynn. Since they seem to want to let the whole situation pass, from their lack of care and professionalism, I felt I would let people know how they cut corners by not inspecting the rooms. They failed to respond to my written letter, and are not competent enough to avoid giving another party a key to our room. They claim to be five diamond and they failed at the basic expectations. I am mostly bothered by the lack of response, since I took the time to write them a description of the details, but they don't care to investigate the situation to explain what happened or retrain a room cleaner and inspector so this doesn't happen again. POOR CARELESS MANAGEMENT.
reviews.title: Poor Hotel Operations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Wynn is a gorgeous property, with exceptional service and numerous dining options. Flowers cover the floor and hang from the ceiling near the entrance creating a fairytale feeling. The restaurants are all beautifully decorated and very classy. We had the pleasure of dining at the Country Club, Wazuzu, The Society Club, Stratta, the Pizza Place, and Red 8. The service was excellent, but it can quickly become an expensive experience. The Cafe was nice to grab a quick bite for breakfast or a snack before bed. The pool was large with many chairs available for lounging. Towels and ice water are provided also. They don't miss an opportunity to make your stay exceptional. The rooms are very spacious with many nice touches such as the feature to turn all the lights on or off at one time, or the welcome on the television screen listing your name and giving you the option to review your bill or check out on the TV.
reviews.title: Exceptional Resort, Beware of Noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Vegas for 2 reasons -- Garth Brooks and a babymoon. My wife always wanted to see Garth live in concert and the show was beyond amazing. Worth every penny and then some. Booked our room through Delta Vacations with a price guarantee. The price went down almost $600 so they gave us they money back and we decided to upgrade to a suite. When we checked in, they offered to upsell us to a Salon Suite. By the time we were done we were paying about $200 more than our original package, so we decided to splurge on it. Salon Suite was worth it. Great living room with table, bar and two couches. Bedroom was large with great bathroom. Staff was incredibly accomodating. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing Babymoon, thanks to Wynn Las Vegas!

reviews.text: At $109 - $189 per night they can't really afford to be a 5 Star hotel anymore in terms of service, however the rooms are still nice (for now).
reviews.title: Good Value, but Service Slipping with the economy - still top 3 on the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you book a combination Air and Hotel package on Expedia / Travelocitgy etc. you can get bargain basement prices even on the busiest weekends you book in advance. I paid $700 for 3 nights with air from LA for Valentines Day weekend - booked 1 week in advance - flew the times I wanted.
reviews.title: Worth Every Moment of Anticipation
Love it!
reviews.text: It is important to Suck Up while checking in to achieve the best room / view / floor... unless you want to pay up for the same - the staff has a lot of flex here. Be nice and get upgraded to a high floor with Panoramic view for free - mine was stunning. Also DON'T WAIT UNTIL 3:00 PM to CHECK IN - early check-in gets better (happier staff) rooms... by 3:00 it's a Zoo => understaffed - you could wait 45 minutes.
Make sure to stay on a high floor to avoid the noise from the nightclub - keep above 30 or you may be awake until 2:00 AM... unless you want to be a the nightclubs...
reviews.title: For a 5 star hotel, they were "cheap"

reviews.text: I stayed at the Wynn with 14 other ladies. It was a great location for our group because it was a)on the strip and b)across from the mall and c)offered something for everyone.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Sheer opulence
Wynn Hotel
reviews.text: - rooms are spacious and nicely appointed

reviews.title: Parasol Bar in the Wynn Hotel
reviews.text: - bathrooms are big as well
- nice view of the strip
reviews.title: WOW! This was a FANTASTIC hotel!

reviews.text: I haved stayed at The Wynn and The Encore several times so this time we decided to stay in the tower suites. The standard room was beautiful however my mother decided she wanted to up grade to the Salon Suite! That room was outstanding!! I see why they were awarded 5 diamonds and 5 stars. Each one of the staff members we encountered were amazing. I really didn't want to leave. We decided that we will throw my mother's birthday/retirement party in one of their fantastic suites!!!
reviews.title: I didn't want to leave!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time to stay at the Wynn in Las Vegas. My husband and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The hotel is immaculate and not as smoky as most in the casino area. The rooms are gorgeous. There is TV in the bathroom, along with a stand-alone shower and huge tub! The beds are comfortable too! We feel so pampered for the price! This hotel is not stuffed to the brim with people just walking through it like Caesars and the Bellagio. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at the Wynn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have returned today after spending 8 days at The Wynn, Las Vegas, and what a fabulous hotel. We stayed on the 54th floor at the back of the hotel overlooking the golf course - and watching the planes arriving!!!! We did think about requesting an upgrade as a treat but our room was huge so totally unnecessary. It was also elegantly furnished with just about everything that would be be needed. The staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful and there was a choice of several restaurants, coffee shops and bars catering for just about everybody. As the hotel was situated on the "Strip" there was a public bus stop right outside, plus it was comparatively easy to walk further into the Strip to view other hotels and attractions. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed in Wynn Encore excellent rooms pity about the view we were on the 5th floor looking nowhere - we had 3 rooms booked would have though that they could give us better views on the basis we were staying there 1 week
reviews.title: A slick and quality operation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However selection of restaurants excellent- but pricey - every thing is catered for -
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at the wynn. It was just walking distance to the convention which was absolutely perfect. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, the staff and especially cleaning ladies were very friendly. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful in making our weekend eventful and fun.
reviews.title: Great Hotel very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading many reviews on the Wynn, I was a little concerned as to what we would find there. However, I was pleased with our four night stay. The Desk personnel were pleasant and helpful. The buffet was a wonderful experience and should not be missed . The hotel room was clean and well kept and with a panoramic view that was magnificent. One day our room was not made up but a phone call to housekeeping did get us clean towels. I think the location of the hotel is a deterent to our return. It's just a little too far from the hubbub I expect from Las Vegas. However, if you are looking for upscale and refined, this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: A nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Steve Wynn is a master at running hotels and this is one of his best! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there although we were sorry we didn't take our golf clubs. The rooms are clean & spacious, the hotel staff is friendly & accommodating, the restaurants are top notch, and you won't be sorry you stayed there. If you want excellent service & 5 star dining then this is your place.
reviews.title: Always fun at the Wynn Las Vegas...

reviews.text: Their restaurants offer a variety of cuisines to satisfy everyone. We particularly enjoyed the Italian restaurant, the steak house, and the buffet (which was one of the best I've seen & tasted). Their desserts at the buffet take up a whole room, like a diabetic nightmare, but I thought I was in Heaven. I still daydream about it.
reviews.title: Clean and Fun

reviews.text: If your looking for a getaway to las vegas? Consider going to the Wynn. The Wynn's rooms are very nice and comfy. The spa is fantastic, and the food is exceptional. The Wynn also offers gambling. If you are looking for a nice vacation go to the Wynn.
reviews.title: Amazing view from room
Perfect hotel to stay in Las Vegas
reviews.text: The property is on the end of the strip, which makes it also very exclusive in way, since it is not on the walking way like other ones in the strip.... The rooms are spacious... If you can afford , go for a suite and if not panoramic rooms are very nice to enjoy the lights of the city especially during night.. The staff are very professional and helpful.. Many pepole think it is a pricey stay, sure it is, but it is different than all the other properties in Las Vegas and there is a price for that.... The property kept very welll and renovated probably over the 6 years... It is quiter, exclusive stay you would feel and which will make you come back again. I beilive their rate of repated customer remained high since they opened... Will stay there when in Las Vegas... Simply perfect.. Don't miss Le reve show which is in the property....

reviews.title: Viva Las Vegas
reviews.text: Just avoid Okada restaurant, go anywhere in the property for dinner.... the worst dinner we had there did not spoil all our time in Wynn, but that place is such a disgrace to this wonderful property... not worth for risk of trying - would be major disappointment...

reviews.title: One of the best options in Vegas
reviews.text: After a exhausting journey to Las Vegas we arrive at the airport, we don't have transfer so we decide to get a stretch limo to our hotel, we have it for 1hr which is $70 but there is 8 of us so nothing much really. We toured the strip old and new then we were dropped off at the hotel.

reviews.title: Very, Very Disappointing
reviews.text: First impression it looked amazing!! there is a massive Louis Vuitton by the entrance what isn't there to love!

reviews.title: Love it !!
reviews.text: Check in took forever!! we had 3 rooms and we're expected to put a deposit down for each room i can't remember how much it was but it was a lot something like $2000-3000

This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel complex, first for a girls trip at Encore, second and most recently at the Wynn for a wedding. If you're booking in well in advance (a couple of months prior), a good tip is to join their e-newsletter update, they offer great deals. We got a spring deal that offered 50% off rooms. We had booked a room with two double beds and received a room with a king. Once we made contacted the front desk they provided us with the correct room which was comforting. After perusing through the Las Vegas strip making our way through various hotels, this was one of our favourites. Its modern, spacious and well thought out. The hotel offers one of the best buffets with a wide range of delicious food, a great pool and two night clubs (XS, and Tryst). If you're staying at the hotel, you can go to the concierge for discounted tickets and line by pass. Girls, if you know a promoter you can get in free.
reviews.title: Unbelieveable hotel - good food, good features

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside of the Wynn food, there are alot of options. Some that we tried included:
reviews.title: Very nice hotel on the Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tacos El Gordo - If you're in the mood for really good tacos, go next door for fresh, authentic, cheap tacos ($2-$3/each) with chicken, pork, beef and all types of cuts. This was one of the best meals we had. Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria & Cucina at Crystals, CityCenter for tasty Italian food at reasonable prices. Mandarin Orientals High Tea (perfect for bridal showers) had a good range of mini sandwiches, and decadent desserts.
reviews.title: Floor to Ceiling Views! Relaxed Refinement!

reviews.text: We have been here on our anniversary in 2009. At that time, the hotel was brand new and everything looked so lovely especially the impressive Lake of Dream.
reviews.title: Service Slightly Slipping, but it's still the Wynn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At check-in, I told them that we stay here for our special occasion. They immediately offered an upgrade for the Deluxe Panoramic room without additional charge. We felt in love with the room as we got a clear view of the Strip at night.
reviews.title: Fabulous but flawed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Wynn for 4 nights in March. We had been to Las Vegas 10 years ago and chose the Wynn as the reviews indicated it to be one of the best hotels in Vegas. It is a beautiful hotel and our room was large and luxurious with floor to ceiling windows. We stayed from Thursday to Monday.
reviews.title: Watch out for nightclub noise

reviews.text: On the Thursday we had a peaceful night's sleep but on the Friday we were woken by banging music and shouting from the nightclub which went on until 4.30am. We politely asked to be moved the next morning and the receptionist whilst polite said that the hotel was sold out and she wasn't sure first whether she could move us and secondly couldn't guarantee we wouldn't hear the nightclub from any room in the hotel. This seems quite ridiculous for such a high class hotel but with the Encore facing the Wynn apparently there are nightclubs at either end. She said the noise tends to bounce off the mountain whatever that means.
reviews.title: very nice ,we got a great deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway they did move us further into the centre of the hotel, exactly the same style room overlooking the golf course. However as she suggested we could still hear the nightclub on the Saturday although not quite as loudly. Luckily it isn't open on Sunday nights so we escaped with a nights sleep that night.
reviews.title: A nice hotel, but...

reviews.text: It seems that Las Vegas now only caters for those who wish to party till all hours which seems extremely short sighted when it is often the more mature who have the money to spend.
reviews.title: Very Good Casino Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Wynn was too expensive to eat in so we breakfasted in Treasure Island across the road and tried various other buffets. We had stayed in the Luxor ten years ago and after two sleepless nights, rather wished we had tried that again.
reviews.title: Lesson learned...stay in Tower Suites
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: Myself and my husband spent 5 nights here and had the most amazing time, it was my first time to stay here but my husband stayed before. We were on the 59th floor overlooking the strip with the most amazing views, our room was very large with a huge bed and the bathroom was also very large. This hotel caters for all with types of people with at least 10+ restaurants and a huge buffet that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner all you can eat ... Amazing. The whole hotel is very plush and the staff couldn't do enough for you. The pool area is also lovely there is a quiet family end then a walkway to the bar and the younger people's pool with the bar and food. You couldnt go wrong with the Wynn Hotel.
The Wynn in Las Vegas is no doubt a beautiful hotel/casino. We got an air/room bundled deal that was reasonable, so we expected a fun but not too costly five day stay. Wrong.
reviews.title: Very Professional (too stiff) and Very Pricey

reviews.text: The good news is that our room was gorgeous; it was extremely well decorated and the view of the strip and the mountains in the distance was stunning. The lobby, casino and shopping areas were also first class.
reviews.title: The place to be in Vegas - Solid 5 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic place to stay in Vegas!!! Facilities are great, the pool was a bit crowded, but the rooms were great, casino is great, the buffet (specially for brunch) is spectacular. Some good stores, a very convenient location. The golf course is beautiful but given the other options nearby it is a bit too expensive.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The Wynn is a great property...Beautiful, not nearly as crowded feel during the day. I do not like to stay at the " pedestrian" hotels in the middle of the strip, where there is alot of in and out foot traffic. This hotel "fit the bill" in comparison to others in Las Vegas. I gave my rating on a comparison to others in Las Vegas only. A Negative: I really object to the fact that in any casino hotel that I have stayed, there is no coffee service in room. The distance between any room and a cafe in a casino is huge and people that want coffee first thing in the morning will have a problem with this!
reviews.title: Beautiful Property,Great for Casino Hotel....

reviews.text: Yes, you are " nickled and dimed " for any additional service, water, opening the room refridgerator for more than 60 seconds, etc., but as much as I have seen in Vegas, this is usual in most resort- casino hotels.
reviews.title: Vegas Vacation

reviews.text: Make sure you request staying on a high floor not directly over pool "club" if you want quiet at late night (except Tuesdays, which are "dark"). Even on 52nd floor, I could hear the sound from the club. The A/C is great as we were there during a heat wave. It was 108 one night at 9:30 P.M.
reviews.title: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent

reviews.text: The Parasol lounge is nice. The Cafe has nice little snack or small lunch offerings, with some healthy choices and coffee drinks (as well as not so healthy choices in the bakery department, but VERY delicious!). Pool area is huge and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Worst stay in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights recently at the Wynn on a 3 week tour of the west coast of the US and it was a fabulous experience. There is very little to complain about and anything negative is slight. It is however very pricey but we knew this in advance having visited last year when we stayed at the Trump. Overall, I prefered this place to the Trump because it has more character, is a lot more colourful, has the casino experience, has a better pool and because the staff there go the extra distance to make your holiday complete.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel - loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Second time is a charm...

reviews.text: * the view of the Strip - we overlooked Treasure Island, the Trump and the Mirage. There was none of the noise from nightclubs that others have alluded to in earlier reviews.
reviews.title: Quality Accommodations in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * the bathroom - I could have spent hours in that bathroom. It was so spacious and fab.
reviews.title: AWESOME HOTEL AND CASINO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * the bedroom - beautiful white leather suite, spacious, a lovely comfy bed, great lighting and lay out generally, electronic drapes to open/close the wall to wall curtains with
reviews.title: Another Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: birhday trip for wifes 40th,hotel very nice,rooms huge,bed very big and comtable,room service good,cleaned and restocked with bathhroon toileties every day.as said by others dont touch the snacks and mini bar things as if you remove for more than 60 secs you are charged,when room service came to replace crisps that showed to be eaten but wernt she took item off bill as they were moved by wires from tv by mistake.didnt eat there as price seem a little expensive but it was a 5 star hotel.hotel,casino and other parts of the premises were kept very clean.
reviews.title: WYNN,WYNN,WYNN

reviews.text: check in took 10 mins as it was 8.00pm when we arrived,didnt bother with $20 trick as prev reviews said it doesnt work here as all rooms were the same,we were given a room on the 14th floor with a view of strip.very nice,did hear a little noice but wasnt too bad.just shut the vent did the trick.staff was helpful in all request,from resception to bell boy.even to staff doing online checkin for us
reviews.title: Four Star Prices, 1 Star Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: would go back again
reviews.title: luxury at the highest standard but buyer beware!

reviews.text: We were looking for a getaway with my wife, her sister, and my neice and nephew, and when we saw on Southwest Vacations that we could get a reasonable price to stay at the Wynn, we decided to give it a try.
reviews.title: So Smug they forget that you are the customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, it seemed that they were looking for ways to milk the guest - from charging us to get adjoining rooms, to the $10 to walk through the Ferrari dealership. If you want to sun yourself in the chairs in the first row around one of the swimming pools, it was an additional $100-$400 (but in fairness, you did get complimentary water).
reviews.title: Best of VEEEGAS!

reviews.text: I was lucky enough to get into "the tower" suites. These rooms are much better than the room I stayed in last time, where the walls were paper-thin. Last time, I asked to be moved after hearing guys in the room adjacent having a polite quiet conversation. I could literally hear every word.
reviews.title: Decent hotel; but nickel and diming on everything is a turn-off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I had this time had a great view and is otherwise fine. Here are some extra charges to expect: use of the gym: $30 (approx) per day
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
European 5 star standard
reviews.text: internet in your room: $20 per 24 hrs approx.
1 oz of pretzels: $8.00 (wow)
reviews.title: Great stay at The Wynn!

reviews.text: you want to see the Ferraris in the showroom? $12
reviews.title: Wynn takes your breath away.....
You just can't beat it
reviews.text: I have stayed in most of the Vegas hotels at this point and just can't beat the Wynn for service and having it all worked out. Sometimes the service can be OTT but thats not a very good complaint for me to make.

reviews.title: luxurious
reviews.text: If you are looking for quality its the best.

reviews.title: Great hotel definitely light compared to others!
reviews.text: I am not a hard person to please. I am also not high-maintenance. I am sure for those who lives among luxury and contributed to this nation's trillion dollars debt who only think about themselves would knit pick this hotel apart starting from color, decorations to staffs. I must say my experience here was pleasant and extremely comfortable.

reviews.title: Las Vegas at its glitziest best
reviews.text: Starting from the friendly valet parking service, like every other 4+ star hotel. We did not have to wait in line at all to check-in. the registration clerk behind the desk was knowledgeable and friendly. the room is clean, organized with a floor to ceiling wall to wall window. Bed and pillows are heavenly. Bath tub is huge and filled up fast. the 2 sinks allowed me to get ready without waiting forever for my girlfriend to be done (although I still have to wait for her after but the true HDTV helped.)

reviews.title: Great stay!
reviews.text: We stayed on the strip side of the hotel. I must say being on the 27th floor the view is beautiful but I think there is a club right outside by the waterfall. It gets loud at night, housekeeping brought us free ear-plugs in a timely fashion which helped tremendously.

aka: Wynn Las Vegas Hotel Las Vegas
